commit message:
[issue #82] Replaced 'anonymous' String array by 'Track' object when querying for track info, allowing separation of the data, and the way it's displayed.
Tried to address issue with timezone between the 'track date' (uses default Locale) and the GPS timestamps (UTC) by using the first GPS timestamp as 'start time'. Not ideal though...
[issue#73] When displaying track with OSM background enabled, zoomLevel will always be set to the last used zoomLevel
[issue #73] Used constant for Preference key
[issue #82] Dealt with dodgy notification system
[issue #94] Added option for GPS logging interval
[issue #88] Added Finnish translation, thanks to sloworks.fi
[issue #82] Layout rework. Probably more in the Android look & feel but still needs some more tweaking.
[issue #94] Code cleanup + added dialog message thanks to Matthias advice
[issue #82] Layout rework. Used a list to display track information to match some other Android screens using this UI (See Android 'about' screen for example)
[issue #82] Added track ID to the export directory name
[issue #94] Used seconds instead of ms for GPS logging interval
[issue #81] Added partial Thai translation thanks to arthit,  lewcpe, kitty.in.th, theppitak.
[issue #26] Updated Danish translation
Preparing release v0.5.2

[issue #61] Changed handling of text note dialog. The dialog will now remember the text when screen orientation changes. The text note will be deleted if the user cancels the dialog to avoid invalid waypoints.
typo in javadoc
[issue #61] Minor cleanup (mostly fixed comments)
[issue #61] Modified TextNoteDialog to correctly handle waypoint deletion if the user cancels the dialog by pressing the 'back' button.
[issue #94] Removed GPS logging interval option as the way it's implemented in Android is not suitable for OSMTracker

[issue #99] Replaced dodgy notification system by a single un-cleareable notification  that stays displayed when a track recording is in progress.
Ensured we start tracking with the correct track id, instead of relying on the fact that the service will be destroyed/recreated each time (currentTrackId was read only in onCreate() )
Ensured that if the TrackLogger activity is brought on top again, we're using the correct trackId.
[issue #100] Added preference to choose if the screen keeps on during tracking or not. Changed handling of shared preferences in TrackLogger.java.
[ issue 103 ] added translation to Slovak (thanks to prescott66)
[issue #46] Now using JAR library of osmdroid instead of the source.
[issue #46] Removed empty directories
[issue #69] Minor cleanup: removed remaining warning when it made sense to use @SuppressWarning(unused)
[issue #46] removed service element of osmdroid from AndroidManifest.xml
[issue #104] fixed crash in DisplayTrackMap when there is no GPS fix while trying to center the map to GPS position.
Fixed some imports that have been automatically added during development.

changed behavior of TrackListAdapter to update trackpoints and waypoints only once within a screen update.

measured difference:
before:
INFO/ActivityManager(1284): Displayed activity me.guillaumin.[...]/.activity.TrackManager: 1432 ms (total 1432 ms)
after:
INFO/ActivityManager(1284): Displayed activity me.guillaumin.[...]/.activity.TrackManager: 938 ms (total 938 ms)
[issue #87] changed handling of trackpoint updates in Map view to improve performance. Thanks to Paul O'Shea.
[issue #28, issue #85, issue #89] It is now possible to stop the active track or resume an old track from the track manager context menu.
[issue #91] Changed the way to get information about a track. This improves performance of the TrackManager.
Fixed a 'typo' in javadoc.
[issue #100] removed layout wrappers that have been used to keep screen on or off and changed DisplayTrackMap to make use of the preference 'Screen always on'.
[issue #28] TrackManager now sends an intend every time a new track is activated to prevent an issue that caused GPSLogger not to change the active track if it was already logging another track.
[issue #20] Updated Italian translation. (Thanks to Diego Pierotto)
[issue #24] Updated German translation.
[issue #109] Added translation for Brazilian Portuguese. (Thanks to Djavan 'dnoway')
[issue #94, r257] Reimplemented GPS logging interval. It now uses some kind of a 'simulated interval'.
[issue #94, r279] Changed behavior of GPS logging interval for GPS status changes.

Fixed screen rotation issues when entering a note.
Fixed GPS logging interval handling.
Fixed notification problems.
Screen can now automatically be turned off.
Ability to pause and resume tracking.
Ability to stop tracking from the track list.
Performance improvements on track list.
New/updated translations: Slovak, Italian, German, Brazilian Pt.
